description: From Middle French émulation, from Latin aemulātiōnem, accusative singular form of aemulātiō.

entries.meaning: The endeavor or desire to equal or excel someone else in qualities or actions.
examples: a great figure who is worthy of respect and emulation
Scarce two gentlemen dwell together in the country  […] , but there is emulation betwixt them and their servants, some quarrel or some grudge betwixt their wives or children  […]

entries.meaning: (computing) Execution of a program or other software designed for a different system, by simulating parts of the other system.
